intro: Mammillaria vaupelii, commonly known as the Vaupel’s nipple cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its small, globular shape and is covered in white, woolly bristles. The plant has a short, thick stem with prominent areoles from which spines and flowers emerge. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and bloom in the spring. Mammillaria vaupelii is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
